item.title: Eclipse IoT case study: An IoT Software Suite to Connect Products to Customers’ Business
item.description: We chose Kura because it is open source and allows us and our technical partners to integrate the protocol and logic with a high level language – Java

item.title: Eclipse IoT case study: An IoT Software Suite to Connect Products to Customers’ Business
IoT Summit: An opportunity to learn what open source can offer to IoT
item.description: The Eclipse IoT community has grown significantly over the last 1-2 years. There are now 20+ Eclipse IoT projects building open source technology for IoT solutions. We are well on our way to providing the key building blocks developers need to build IoT solutions…

item.title: Introduction to OPC-UA: Interoperability for Industrial Automation & Industrial IoT
item.description: OPC-UA is the interoperability standard for the secure and reliable exchange of data and information in the industrial automation space and in other industries. It is platform independent and ensures …

item.title: Eclipse IoT case study: Building Virtual Power Plants
item.description: The market has a lot of raw data coming from smart PDUs, but they need a software layer on top of that data to make it useful

Eclipse IoT case study: Monitoring Industrial Power Distribution
item.description: We wanted a SCADA system we could use with access to some of the developers, which gives us the exibility to adjust the system to our needs and grow over time.

item.title: Eclipse IoT case study: Monitoring Industrial Power Distribution
Eclipse IoT’s 2015 Year in Review
item.description:
Come the end of the year and you usually want to look back at what you’ve accomplished during the past twelve months.

For us, at Eclipse IoT, it’s been a pretty busy and successful year! So without further ado, here are the 5 most noteworthy things that happened in the Eclipse IoT community this year.…
